verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> He was also <S%G2532><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> to the disciples, <S%G3101><s%> "There was a certain <S%G5100><s%> rich <S%G4145><s%> man <S%G444><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> a steward, <S%G3623><s%> and this <S%G3778><s%> [steward] was reported <S%G1225><s%> to him as squandering <S%G1287><s%> his possessions. <S%G5225><s%>

"And he called <S%G5455><s%> him and said <S%G3004><s%> to him, 'What <S%G5101><s%> is this <S%G3778><s%> I hear <S%G191><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> you? Give <S%G591><s%> an account <S%G3056><s%> of your stewardship, <S%G3622><s%> for you can <S%G1410><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> longer <S%G2089><s%> be steward. <S%G3621><s%>'

"And the steward <S%G3623><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to himself, <S%G1438><s%> 'What <S%G5101><s%> shall I do, <S%G4160><s%> since <S%G3754><s%> my master <S%G2962><s%> is taking <S%G851><s%> the stewardship <S%G3622><s%> away <S%G851><s%> from me? I am <S%G2480><s%> not strong <S%G2480><s%> enough <S%G2480><s%> to dig; <S%G4626><s%> I am ashamed <S%G153><s%> to beg. <S%G1871><s%>

'I know <S%G1097><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> I shall do, <S%G4160><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that when <S%G3752><s%> I am removed <S%G3179><s%> from the stewardship, <S%G3622><s%> they will receive <S%G1209><s%> me into their homes. <S%G3624><s%>'

"And he summoned <S%G4341><s%> each <S%G1538><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of his master <S%G2962><s%>'s debtors, <S%G5533><s%> and he [began] saying <S%G3004><s%> to the first, <S%G4413><s%> 'How <S%G4214><s%> much <S%G4214><s%> do you owe <S%G3784><s%> my master?'

"And he said, <S%G3004><s%> 'A hundred <S%G1540><s%> measures <S%G943><s%> of oil. <S%G1637><s%>' And he said <S%G3004><s%> to him, 'Take <S%G1209><s%> your bill, <S%G1121><s%> and sit <S%G2523><s%> down <S%G2523><s%> quickly <S%G5030><s%> and write <S%G1125><s%> fifty. <S%G4004><s%>'

"Then <S%G1899><s%> he said <S%G3004><s%> to another, <S%G2087><s%> 'And how <S%G4214><s%> much <S%G4214><s%> do you owe <S%G3784><s%>?' And he said, <S%G3004><s%> 'A hundred <S%G1540><s%> measures <S%G2884><s%> of wheat. <S%G4621><s%>' He said <S%G3004><s%> to him, 'Take <S%G1209><s%> your bill, <S%G1121><s%> and write <S%G1125><s%> eighty. <S%G3589><s%>'

"And his master <S%G2962><s%> praised <S%G1867><s%> the unrighteous <S%G93><s%> steward <S%G3623><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> he had acted <S%G4160><s%> shrewdly; <S%G5430><s%> for the sons <S%G5207><s%> of this <S%G3778><s%> age <S%G165><s%> are more <S%G5429><s%> shrewd <S%G5429><s%> in relation <S%G1519><s%> to their own <S%G1438><s%> kind <S%G1074><s%> than <S%G5228><s%> the sons <S%G5207><s%> of light. <S%G5457><s%>

"And I say <S%G3004><s%> to you, make <S%G4160><s%> friends <S%G5384><s%> for yourselves <S%G1438><s%> by means <S%G1537><s%> of the mammon <S%G3126><s%> of unrighteousness; <S%G93><s%> that when <S%G3752><s%> it fails, <S%G1587><s%> they may receive <S%G1209><s%> you into the eternal <S%G166><s%> dwellings. <S%G4633><s%>

"He who is faithful <S%G4103><s%> in a very <S%G1646><s%> little <S%G1646><s%> thing <S%G1646><s%> is faithful <S%G4103><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> in much; <S%G4183><s%> and he who is unrighteous <S%G94><s%> in a very <S%G1646><s%> little <S%G1646><s%> thing <S%G1646><s%> is unrighteous <S%G94><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> in much. <S%G4183><s%>

"If <S%G1487><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> you have not been <S%G1096><s%> faithful <S%G4103><s%> in the [use of] unrighteous <S%G94><s%> mammon, <S%G3126><s%> who <S%G5101><s%> will entrust <S%G4100><s%> the true <S%G228><s%> [riches] to you?
"And if <S%G1487><s%> you have not been <S%G1096><s%> faithful <S%G4103><s%> in [the use of] that which is another's, who <S%G5101><s%> will give <S%G1325><s%> you that which is your own?

"No <S%G3762><s%> servant <S%G3610><s%> can <S%G1410><s%> serve <S%G1398><s%> two <S%G1417><s%> masters; <S%G2962><s%> for either <S%G2228><s%> he will hate <S%G3404><s%> the one, <S%G1520><s%> and love <S%G25><s%> the other, <S%G2087><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> else <S%G2228><s%> he will hold <S%G472><s%> to one, <S%G1520><s%> and despise <S%G2706><s%> the other. <S%G2087><s%> You cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3756><s%> serve <S%G1398><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> and mammon. <S%G3126><s%>"

Now <S%G1161><s%> the Pharisees, <S%G5330><s%> who were lovers <S%G5366><s%> of money, <S%G5366><s%> were listening <S%G191><s%> to all <S%G3956><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things, <S%G3778><s%> and they were scoffing <S%G1592><s%> at Him.

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "You are those <S%G3588><s%> who justify <S%G1344><s%> yourselves <S%G1438><s%> in the sight <S%G1799><s%> of men, <S%G444><s%> but God <S%G2316><s%> knows <S%G1097><s%> your hearts; <S%G2588><s%> for that which is highly <S%G5308><s%> esteemed <S%G5308><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> men <S%G444><s%> is detestable <S%G946><s%> in the sight <S%G1799><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

"The Law <S%G3551><s%> and the Prophets <S%G4396><s%> [were proclaimed] until <S%G3360><s%> John; <S%G2491><s%> since <S%G575><s%> then <S%G5119><s%> the gospel <S%G2097><s%> of the kingdom <S%G932><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> is preached, <S%G2097><s%> and everyone <S%G3956><s%> is forcing <S%G971><s%> his way <S%G971><s%> into it.

"But it is easier <S%G2123><s%> for heaven <S%G3772><s%> and earth <S%G1093><s%> to pass <S%G3928><s%> away <S%G3928><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> for one <S%G1520><s%> stroke <S%G2762><s%> of a letter <S%G2762><s%> of the Law <S%G3551><s%> to fail. <S%G4098><s%>

"Everyone <S%G3956><s%> who divorces <S%G630><s%> his wife <S%G1135><s%> and marries <S%G1060><s%> another <S%G2087><s%> commits <S%G3431><s%> adultery; <S%G3431><s%> and he who marries <S%G1060><s%> one who is divorced <S%G630><s%> from a husband <S%G435><s%> commits <S%G3431><s%> adultery. <S%G3431><s%>

"Now <S%G1161><s%> there was a certain <S%G5100><s%> rich <S%G4145><s%> man, <S%G444><s%> and he habitually dressed <S%G1737><s%> in purple <S%G4209><s%> and fine <S%G1040><s%> linen, <S%G1040><s%> gaily <S%G2165><s%> living <S%G2165><s%> in splendor <S%G2988><s%> every <S%G2596><s%> day. <S%G2250><s%>

"And a certain <S%G5100><s%> poor <S%G4434><s%> man <S%G4434><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Lazarus <S%G2976><s%> was laid <S%G906><s%> at his gate, <S%G4440><s%> covered <S%G1669><s%> with sores, <S%G1669><s%>

and longing <S%G1937><s%> to be fed <S%G5526><s%> with the [crumbs] which were falling <S%G4098><s%> from the rich <S%G4145><s%> man's table; <S%G5132><s%> besides, <S%G235><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> the dogs <S%G2965><s%> were coming <S%G2064><s%> and licking <S%G7078><s%> his sores. <S%G1668><s%>

"Now <S%G1161><s%> it came <S%G1096><s%> about that the poor <S%G4434><s%> man <S%G4434><s%> died <S%G599><s%> and he was carried <S%G667><s%> away <S%G667><s%> by the angels <S%G32><s%> to Abraham's bosom; <S%G2859><s%> and the rich <S%G4145><s%> man <S%G4145><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> died <S%G599><s%> and was buried. <S%G2290><s%>

"And in Hades <S%G86><s%> he lifted <S%G1869><s%> up his eyes, <S%G3788><s%> being <S%G5225><s%> in torment, <S%G931><s%> and saw <S%G3708><s%> Abraham <S%G11><s%> far <S%G3113><s%> away, <S%G575><s%> <S%G3113><s%> and Lazarus <S%G2976><s%> in his bosom. <S%G2859><s%>

"And he cried <S%G5455><s%> out and said, <S%G3004><s%> 'Father <S%G3962><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> have <S%G1653><s%> mercy <S%G1653><s%> on me, and send <S%G3992><s%> Lazarus, <S%G2976><s%> that he may dip <S%G911><s%> the tip <S%G206><s%> of his finger <S%G1147><s%> in water <S%G5204><s%> and cool <S%G2711><s%> off my tongue; <S%G1100><s%> for I am <S%G3600><s%> in agony <S%G3600><s%> in this <S%G3778><s%> flame. <S%G5395><s%>'

"But Abraham <S%G11><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'Child, <S%G5043><s%> remember <S%G3403><s%> that during <S%G1722><s%> your life <S%G2222><s%> you received <S%G618><s%> your good <S%G18><s%> things, <S%G18><s%> and likewise <S%G3668><s%> Lazarus <S%G2976><s%> bad <S%G2556><s%> things; <S%G2556><s%> but now <S%G3568><s%> he is being comforted <S%G3870><s%> here, <S%G5602><s%> and you are in agony. <S%G3600><s%>

'And besides <S%G1722><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> this, <S%G3778><s%> between <S%G3342><s%> us and you there is a great <S%G3173><s%> chasm <S%G5490><s%> fixed, <S%G4741><s%> in order <S%G3704><s%> that those <S%G3588><s%> who wish <S%G2309><s%> to come <S%G1224><s%> over <S%G1224><s%> from here <S%G7071><s%> to you may not be able, <S%G1410><s%> and [that] none <S%G3366><s%> may cross <S%G1276><s%> over <S%G1276><s%> from there <S%G1564><s%> to us.'
"And he said, <S%G3004><s%> 'Then <S%G3767><s%> I beg <S%G2065><s%> you, Father, <S%G3962><s%> that you send <S%G3992><s%> him to my father's house <S%G3624><s%> –

for I have <S%G2192><s%> five <S%G4002><s%> brothers <S%G80><s%> – that he may warn <S%G1263><s%> them, lest <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> they also <S%G2532><s%> come <S%G2064><s%> to this <S%G3778><s%> place <S%G5117><s%> of torment. <S%G931><s%>'
"But Abraham <S%G11><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'They have <S%G2192><s%> Moses <S%G3475><s%> and the Prophets; <S%G4396><s%> let them hear <S%G191><s%> them.'

"But he said, <S%G3004><s%> 'No, <S%G3780><s%> Father <S%G3962><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> but if <S%G1437><s%> someone <S%G5100><s%> goes <S%G4198><s%> to them from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> they will repent! <S%G3340><s%>'

"But he said <S%G3004><s%> to him, 'If <S%G1487><s%> they do not listen <S%G191><s%> to Moses <S%G3475><s%> and the Prophets, <S%G4396><s%> neither <S%G3761><s%> will they be persuaded <S%G3982><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> someone <S%G5100><s%> rises <S%G450><s%> from the dead. <S%G3498><s%>'"
